Author: RVKH
Text: tbh i find that watching those what i ate in a day: binge videos on youtube helps me. on the one hand, i can live vicariously through the person eating all that delicious food. on the other hand, thereâ€™s always a really sad undertone to them and you can tell how disappointed and regretful the video creator is, which stops me from wanting to binge myself. for me, theyâ€™re very effective at curbing cravings and simultaneously reminding me of how awful bingeing actually is. but be careful bc they may trigger you ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜…

Author: paperklipp
Text: Next time you binge and you start to feel like crap, open a Note on your phone and write down in detail every shitty aspect of every shitty feeling youâ€™re experiencing, and then save it. Youâ€™ll know itâ€™s there next time and if you really want to stop yourself, you can go and read it. If you decide itâ€™s been too long of a restriction period and you need to refeed (or if you just decide you want the food more than you want to stop, which is also fine), ignore the Note and go ahead and eat.
